content: to work-related publications. - Expenses for home office use, if you work from home. 2. Motor Vehicle Expenses: If you use your vehicle for work-related purposes, you may be eligible to claim deductions for motor vehicle expenses. This can include fuel, repairs and maintenance, insurance, registration fees, and depreciation. It's important to keep accurate records and choose the appropriate method for calculating your deduction, such as the logbook method or cents per kilometre method. 3. Self-Education Expenses: If you undertake self-education that is directly related to your current employment or is likely to result in increased income in your current field, you can claim deductions for self-education expenses. This includes course fees, textbooks, stationery, and travel expenses. 4. Rental Property Expenses: If you own a rental property, you can deduct various expenses associated with its management and maintenance. This includes interest on loans, council rates, property management fees, repairs, and insurance premiums. 5. Donations to Registered Charities: Donations made to registered charities are generally tax-deductible. Supporting a cause you believe in while reducing your tax liability is a win-win situation. Remember to ensure that the charity is registered with the Australian Charities and Not-for-profits Commission (ACNC) to qualify for the
